cards.title: Viennese whirl / Twirling Dirndl burlesque gala

item.title: Photo highlights of the day
item.trailText: The Guardian’s picture editors bring you a selection of the best photographs from around the world
item.standFirst: The Guardian’s picture editors bring you a selection of the best photographs from around the world including the farmers’ protests in Peru, Bangladeshi migrants in Indonesia and the start of U2’s new world tour

displayImages.caption: Woburn, UK Former member of the girl band the Spice Girls, Geri Halliwell, marries Christian Horner, Red Bull Formula One team principal at St. Mary’s Church. Photograph: Toby Melville/Reuters
displayImages.altText: Woburn, UK Former member of the girl band the Spice Girls, Geri Halliwell, marries Christian Horner, Red Bull Formula One team principal at St. Mary's Church.
displayImages.cleanCaption: Woburn, UK Former member of the girl band the Spice Girls, Geri Halliwell, marries Christian Horner, Red Bull Formula One team principal at St. Mary’s Church.

displayImages.caption: Cocachacra, Peru Farmers opposed to a mining project in their city clash with riot police. Farmers and local leaders fear that the Tia Maria open-pit mine will contaminate irrigation water in the rice farming-rich Tambo valley on Peru’s desert coast Photograph: Martin Mejia/AP
displayImages.altText: Cocachacra, Peru Farmers opposed to a mining project in their city clash with riot police. Farmers and local leaders fear that the Tia Maria open-pit mine will contaminate irrigation water in the rice farming-rich Tambo valley on Peru’s desert coast.
displayImages.cleanCaption: Cocachacra, Peru Farmers opposed to a mining project in their city clash with riot police. Farmers and local leaders fear that the Tia Maria open-pit mine will contaminate irrigation water in the rice farming-rich Tambo valley on Peru’s desert coast

displayImages.caption: Santa Clarita, California Jesús Hernández Blázquez of Spain, representing Tinkoff Saxo, cycles through heavy rain during stage five of the 2015 Amgen tour of California Photograph: Doug Pensinger/Getty Images
displayImages.altText: Santa Clarita, California, US Jesus Hernandez Blazquez of Spain riding for Tinkoff-Saxo drives the peloton in the rain as they pursue the breakaway late in race during stage five of the 2015 Amgen Tour of California
displayImages.cleanCaption: Santa Clarita, California Jesús Hernández Blázquez of Spain, representing Tinkoff Saxo, cycles through heavy rain during stage five of the 2015 Amgen tour of California

displayImages.caption: Vienna, Austria Burlesque performer Fräulein Frauke, from Sweden, performs during the Twirling Dirndl Burlesque gala at the Boylesque festival Photograph: Leonhard Foeger/Reuters
displayImages.altText: Vienna, Austria Burlesque performer Fraeulein Frauke from Sweden performs on stage during the "Twirling Dirndl Burlesque Gala" at the Boylesque Festival
displayImages.cleanCaption: Vienna, Austria Burlesque performer Fräulein Frauke, from Sweden, performs during the Twirling Dirndl Burlesque gala at the Boylesque festival

displayImages.caption: Buenos Aires, Argentina Boca Juniors fans cheer their team on before a Copa Libertadores football match against River Plate Photograph: Natacha Pisarenko/AP
displayImages.altText: Buenos Aires, Argentina Boca Juniors fans cheer their team before a Copa Libertadores round of sixteen soccer match against River Plate
displayImages.cleanCaption: Buenos Aires, Argentina Boca Juniors fans cheer their team on before a Copa Libertadores football match against River Plate

displayImages.caption: Manhattan, New York BB King plays his beloved guitar Lucille at the Apollo theatre in Harlem, New York, in 1971. The blues icon, known for his soaring guitar licks and as an inspiration for generations of musicians over a decades-long career, has died aged 89. For more pictures of BB King’s career click here Photograph: Bob Adelman/Corbis
displayImages.altText: Manhattan, New York City, US BB King plays his guitar “Lucille” and sings the blues at the famous Apollo Theater in 1971. Blues legend B.B. King, known for his soaring guitar licks and as an inspiration for generations of musicians over a decades-long career, has died at the age of 89. For more pictures of BB King’s career click here.
displayImages.cleanCaption: Manhattan, New York BB King plays his beloved guitar Lucille at the Apollo theatre in Harlem, New York, in 1971. The blues icon, known for his soaring guitar licks and as an inspiration for generations of musicians over a decades-long career, has died aged 89. For more pictures of BB King’s career click here

displayImages.caption: Kilkis, Greece Syrian migrants walk through a field towards Greece’s border with Macedonia. Hundreds of mostly Afghan, Syrian, and African migrants cross daily from Greece into Macedonia on their way to northern European countries. Most of them are turned back by Macedonian border guards Photograph: Yannis Behrakis/Reuters
displayImages.altText: Kilkis, Greece A group of Syrian immigrants are silhouetted as they walk through a field towards Greece’s border with Macedonia. Hundreds of mostly Afghan, Syrian, and African immigrants cross daily from Greece into Macedonia on their way to northern European countries; most of them are turned back by Macedonian border guards
displayImages.cleanCaption: Kilkis, Greece Syrian migrants walk through a field towards Greece’s border with Macedonia. Hundreds of mostly Afghan, Syrian, and African migrants cross daily from Greece into Macedonia on their way to northern European countries. Most of them are turned back by Macedonian border guards

displayImages.caption: Kuala Langsa, Aceh, Indonesia Bangladeshi migrants carry a sick friend to a temporary shelter. Hundreds of Bangladeshi and ethnic Rohingya migrants have landed on the shores of Indonesia and Thailand after being adrift at sea for weeks Photograph: Binsar Bakkara/AP
displayImages.altText: Kuala Langsa, Aceh, Indonesia Bangladeshi migrants carry a sick friend toward a temporary shelter upon arrival. Hundreds of Bangladeshi and ethnic Rohingya migrants have landed on the shores of Indonesia and Thailand after being adrift at sea for weeks, authorities said Friday.
displayImages.cleanCaption: Kuala Langsa, Aceh, Indonesia Bangladeshi migrants carry a sick friend to a temporary shelter. Hundreds of Bangladeshi and ethnic Rohingya migrants have landed on the shores of Indonesia and Thailand after being adrift at sea for weeks

displayImages.caption: Benalla, Australia Garth Tander drives the No 2 Racing Team Holden during practice for the V8 Supercars Winton SuperSprint at Winton Motor Raceway Photograph: Robert Cianflone/Getty Images
displayImages.altText: Benalla, Australia Garth Tander drives the #2 Holden Racing Team Holden during practice for the V8 Supercars Winton SuperSprint at Winton Motor Raceway
displayImages.cleanCaption: Benalla, Australia Garth Tander drives the No 2 Racing Team Holden during practice for the V8 Supercars Winton SuperSprint at Winton Motor Raceway

displayImages.caption: Vancouver, Canada Bono throws water at the crowd while The Edge plays guitar during U2’s first concert of their world tour Photograph: Jonathan Hayward/AP
displayImages.altText: Vancouver, Canada Bono, of the band U2, throws water at the crowd while the Edge watches as they perform in the band’s first concert of their new world tour
displayImages.cleanCaption: Vancouver, Canada Bono throws water at the crowd while The Edge plays guitar during U2’s first concert of their world tour

displayImages.caption: Beijing, China Soldiers adjust their positions before performing in an honour guard for Narendra Modi outside the Great Hall of the People. The Indian PM is on a three-day state visit to China Photograph: Greg Baker/AFP/Getty Images
displayImages.altText: Beijing, China Chinese soldiers adjust their positioning before performing in an honour guard for India’s Prime Minister Narendra Modi outside the Great Hall of the People. Modi is on a three-day state visit to China
displayImages.cleanCaption: Beijing, China Soldiers adjust their positions before performing in an honour guard for Narendra Modi outside the Great Hall of the People. The Indian PM is on a three-day state visit to China

displayImages.caption: Barcelona, Spain Joakim Lagergren of Sweden hits a practice shot on the driving range before day two of the Open de España, held at Real Club de Golf el Prat Photograph: Dean Mouhtaropoulos/Getty Images
displayImages.altText: Barcelona, Spain Joakim Lagergren of Sweden hits a practice shot on the driving range prior to Day 2 of the Open de Espana held at Real Club de Golf el Prat
displayImages.cleanCaption: Barcelona, Spain Joakim Lagergren of Sweden hits a practice shot on the driving range before day two of the Open de España, held at Real Club de Golf el Prat

displayImages.caption: Buenos Aires, Argentina Midwives bare their breasts to protest against government plans to restrict home births Photograph: Javier Coltrane/Demotix/Corbis
displayImages.altText: Buenos Aires, Argentina Half naked protesters hold up signs in front of cars as they protest against the government’s policies about midwives and the issue of being able to give birth at home. Members and supporters of the Argentina midwives association demanded that childbirths be allowed in the home as they rallied against the government and health ministry policies
displayImages.cleanCaption: Buenos Aires, Argentina Midwives bare their breasts to protest against government plans to restrict home births

displayImages.caption: Shenzhen, China Visitors read books on a 50-metre-long, 30-metre-high Artron Wall at the 11th International Culture Industry Fair Photograph: AFP/Getty Images
displayImages.altText: Shenzhen, China Visitors reading books on a 50 meter long, 30 meter high Artron Wall on display at the 11th International Culture Industry Fair.
displayImages.cleanCaption: Shenzhen, China Visitors read books on a 50-metre-long, 30-metre-high Artron Wall at the 11th International Culture Industry Fair

displayImages.caption: Chicago, Illinois Chicago Bulls forward Pau Gasol reaches for the ball during a scramble against the Cleveland Cavaliers, during the second half of game six in a second-round NBA basketball playoff series Photograph: Nam Y. Huh/AP
displayImages.altText: Chicago, Illinois, US Chicago Bulls forward Pau Gasol (16) reaches for the ball during a scramble against the Cleveland Cavaliers during the second half of Game 6 in a second-round NBA basketball playoff series
displayImages.cleanCaption: Chicago, Illinois Chicago Bulls forward Pau Gasol reaches for the ball during a scramble against the Cleveland Cavaliers, during the second half of game six in a second-round NBA basketball playoff series
